alert.note: Alert for Brantley; Northeastern Charlton; Northern Ware; Western Charlton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 11:51PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN BRANTLEY...EAST CENTRAL WARE AND NORTHEASTERN CHARLTON COUNTIES THROUGH 1230 AM EDT... At 1151 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout near Race Pond, or 12 miles northeast of Stephen Foster State Park, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, wind gusts up to 50 mph, excessive cloud-to-ground lightning, minor flooding due to heavy rainfall, and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Excessive cloud-to-ground lightning is occurring. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Homeland and Race Pond. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Brantley; Northeastern Charlton; Northern Ware; Western Charlton
